boat.name: Dagmar
boat.full_description:
Dagmar  was built by James A Silver Ltd at Rosneath on the Clyde in 1935, for Captain W Ivan Nicholson, of Blythe, Northumberland. Her designer, John Bain, was best known for Motor boats, but Dagmar was not his only auxiliary yacht.

Sometime during WW2 she came into the ownership of EJA Freeman, MC, who kept her first at Ipswich and later at Maldon. She remained in the area under the ownership of F Whitacker who bought her in 1955, and kept her until at least 1973 after which she disappears from the Lloyds register of Yachts. She was given her first engine change since new in this year, with her original Stuart Turner being replaced by a reconditioned Vire.

Dagmar was rescued from the mud in Fareham Creek in 1993, by Alan West of Petersfield, who spent the next ten years renovating her, including fitting a new Yanmar engine.

She came first in class in the Round the Island Race in 2017, before being sold  in 2019.
boat.short_description: A one off yacht, designed by John Bain and built at Rosneath
